meanings.definition: (verb) To have teeth emerge through the gums during infancy.
meanings.sent1: Babies teethe when their first teeth start coming in.
meanings.sent2: It is normal for infants to teethe around six months of age.
meanings.sent3: The baby's constant drooling is a sign that they are starting to teethe.
meanings.sent4: Watching a baby teethe can be both exciting and challenging for parents.
meanings.sent5: The pediatrician explained that the process of teething can vary from child to child.

meanings.definition: (verb) To experience the growth of teeth.
meanings.sent1: As children teethe, they may feel discomfort in their gums.
meanings.sent2: The dentist reassured the parents that their child would teethe normally.
meanings.sent3: The puppy seemed to teethe at an astonishing rate, surprising its owner.
meanings.sent4: The old tree stump appeared to teethe with new growth after the rainy season.
meanings.sent5: The museum displayed a fossilized jawbone showing the process of teething in ancient creatures.
